gurmukhi: ਚਲ ਚਾਲ ਚਿੱਤ || ਪਰਮੰ ਪਵਿੱਤ || ਅਤਿ ਕੋਪਵੰਤ || ਮੁਨ ਤ੍ਰਿਅ ਬਿਅੰਤ ||੨੯||
transliteration: Chal Dhaal Chitt|| Paramannd Pavitt|| At(i) Kopvant|| Mounndtria Beant||29||
translation: Her mind, which was immaculate, was filled with extreme rage alongwith other women of the sages.29.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਪਟੰਤ ਕੇਸ || ਮੁਨ ਤ੍ਰਿਅ ਸੁ ਦੇਸ || ਅਤਿ ਕੋਪ ਅੰਗਿ || ਸੁੰਦਰ ਸੁ ਰੰਗ ||੩੦||
transliteration: Ouptant Kes|| Mounndtria Su Des|| At(i) Kop Aaag(i)|| Soundar Su Ran||30||
translation: The wife of the sage plucked her hair at that place and her comely limbs were filled with extreme ire.30.

gurmukhi: ਤੋਰੰਤ ਹਾਰ || ੳੁਪਟੰਤ ਬਾਰ || ਡਾਰੰਤ ਧੂਰ || ਰੋਖੰਤ ਪੂਰ ||੩੧||
transliteration: Torant Haar|| Ouptant Baar||daarant Dhoor|| Rokhanndpoor||31||
translation: Breaking her necklaces, she plucked her hair and began to put dust hr head.31.

gurmukhi: ਲਖਿ ਕੋਪ ਭੀ ਮੁਨਿ ਨਾਰ || ੳੁਠ ਭਾਜ ਬ੍ਹਮ ੳੁਦਾਰ || ਸ਼ਿਵ ਸੰਗਿ ਲੈ ਰਿਖ ਸਰਬ || ਭਯ ਮਾਨ ਹ੍ਵੈ ਤਜ ਗਰਬ ||੩੨||
transliteration: Lakh(i) Kop Bhimounndi) Naar|| Outh Bhaaj Brahm Udaar|| Shiv San(i) Lai Rich Sarab|| Bhaya Maan Hvai Taj Gadab||32||
translation: Seeing the wife of the sage in anger, getting fearful and forsaking his pride, and taking Shiva and other sages with him, Brahma fled.32.

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਕੋਪ ਕੈ ਮੁਨਿ ਨਾਰ || ਸਿਰ ਕੇਸ ਜਟਾ ੳੁਪਾਰ || ਕਰਿ ਸੌ ਜਬੈ ਕਰ ਮਾਰ || ਤਬ ਲੀਨ ਦੱਤ ਅਵਤਾਰ ||੩੩||
transliteration: Tab Kop Kai Mounndi) Naar|| Sir Kes Jataa Oupaar|| Kar(i) Sau Jabai Kar Maar|| Tab Leen Datt Avtaar||33||
translation: Then the wife of the sage, uprooting one of the matted lock of ther head in anger, strumck it on her hand, at that time Dattatreya was born.33.

gurmukhi: ਕਰ ਬਾਮ ਮਾਤ੍ਰ ਸਮਾਨ || ਕਰ ਦੱਛਨੰਤ੍ਰ ਪ੍ਰਮਾਨ || ਕੀਅਾ ਪਾਨ ਭੋਗ ਬਿਚਾਰ || ਤਬ ਭੲੇ ਦੱਤ ਕੁਮਾਰ ||੩੪||
transliteration: Kar Baam Maatra Samaan|| Kar Dachchhnantra Pramaan|| Keeaa Paan Bhog Bichaar|| Tab Bhae Datt Koumaar||34||
translation: Considering Ansuya as his mother and keeping her on his right, he circumambulated around her and then saluted her; in this way, thinking about the experience of sexual pleasure, Dutt Kumar was born.34.

gurmukhi: ਅਨਭੂਤ ੳੁੱਤਮ ਗਾਤ || ੳੁਚਰੰਤ ਸਿੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਸਾਤ || ਮੁਖ ਬੇਦ ਚਾਰ ਰੜੰਤ || ੳੁਪਜੋ ਸੁ ਦੱਤ ਮਹੰਤ ||੩੫||
transliteration: Anbhooj Outtam Gadt|| Ouchrant Sinmrit Saat|| Moukh Bed Chaar Radant|| Oupjo Su Darr Mahant||35||
translation: His body was charming and he was reciting seven Smrities; the great Dutt was reciting all the four Vedas.35.

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ਿਵ ਸਿਮਰ ਪੂਰਬਲ ਸ੍ਰਾਪ || ਬਪੁ ਦੱਤ ਕੇ ਧਰਿ ਅਾਪ || ੳੁਪਜਿਓਨਿ ਸੂਅਾ ਧਾਮ || ਅਵਤਾਰ || ਪ੍ਰਿਥਮ ਸੁ ਤਾਮ ||੩੬||
transliteration: Shiv Simar Poorbal Sraap|| Bap(u) Datt Ke Dhar(i) Aap|| Oupjion(i) Saaoo Dhaam|| Avtaar Pritham Su Taam||36||
translation: Shiva, remembering the earlier curse assumed himself the body of Dutt and took birth in the home of Ansuya; this was his first incarnation.36.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਪਜਿਓ ਸੁ ਦੱਤ ਮੋਹਨੀ ਮਹਾਨ || ਦਸ ਚਾਰ ਚਾਰ ਬਿਦਿਅਾ ਨਿਧਾਨ || ਸ਼ਾਸਤ੍ਰਗਿ ਸੁਧ ਸੁੰਦਰ ਸਰੂਪ || ਅਵਧੂਤ ਰੂਪ ਗਣ ਸਰਬ ਭੂਪ ||੩੭||
transliteration: Oupjio Su Datt Mohnimahaan|| Das Chaar Chaar Bidiaa Nidhaan|| Shaastrag(i) Sudh Soundar Daroop|| Avdhoot Roop Gad Sarab Bhoop||37||
translation: The loving Dutt, the store of eighteen sciences was born; he was the knower of Shastras and had a charming figure; he was Yogi king of all the ganas.37.

gurmukhi: ਸੰਨਿਅਾਸ ਜੋਗ ਕਿੱਨੋ ਪ੍ਰਕਾਸ || ਪਾਵਨ ਪਵਿਤ੍ਰ ਸਰਬਤ੍ਰ ਦਾਸ || ਜਨੁ ਧਰਿਓ ਅਾਨ ਬਪੁ ਸਰਬ ਜੋਗ || ਤਜਿ ਰਾਜ ਸਾਜ ਅਰੁ ਤਿਅਾਗ ਭੋਗ ||੩੮||
transliteration: Sanniaas Jog Kinno Prakaas|| Paavan Pavitra Sarbatra Daas|| Jan(u) Dhario Aan Bap(u) Sarab Jog|| Taj(i) Raaj Saaj Ar(u) Tiaag Bhog||38||
translation: He spread the cults of Sannyas and Yoga and he was totally spotless and servitor of all; he was the apparent manifestation of Yoga, who abandoned the path of royal pleasure.38.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਛਿੱਜ ਰੂਪ ਮਹਿਮਾ ਮਹਾਨ || ਦਸ ਚਾਰਵੰਤ ਸੋਭਾ ਨਿਧਾਨ || ਰਵਿ ਅਨਲ ਤੇਜ ਜਲ ਸੇ ਸੁਭਾਵ || ੳੁਪਜਿਅਾ ਜਗਤ ਸੰਨਯਾਸ ਰਾਵ ||੩੯||
transliteration: Aacchijj Roop Mahimaa Mahaan|| Das Chaarvant Sobhaa Nidhaan|| Rav(i) Anal Tej Jal Se Soubhaav|| Oupjiaa Jagad Sannyaas Raav||39||
translation: He was greatly praiseworthy, had a charming personality and also the store-house of Grace; his disposition was radiant like sun and fire and had cool temperament like water; he manifested himself as the king of Yogis in the world.39.

gurmukhi: ਸੰਨਯਾਸ ਰਾਜ ਭੲੇ ਦੱਤ ਦੇਵ || ਰੁਦ੍ਰਾਵਤਾਰ ਸੁੰਦਰ ਅਜੇਵ || ਪਾਵਕ ਸਮਾਨ ਭਯੋ ਤੇਜੁ ਜਾਸ || ਬਸੁਧਾ ਸਮਾਨ ਧੀਰਜ ਸੁ ਤਾਸ ||੪੦||
transliteration: Sannyaas Raaj Bhae Datt Dev|| Rudraavataar Soundar Ajev|| Paavak Samaan Bhayo Tej(u) Jaas|| Basudhaa Samaan Dheeraj Su Taas||40||
translation: Dutt Dev was superior to all in Sannyas Ashrama (monastic order) and was becoming incarnation of Rudra; his radiance was like fire and power of Rudra; his radiance was like fire and power endurance like earth.40.
